lines.content: ChatGPT used for the increment A-BetterGui
Helped me with css, making the error bubble to work when an
error message is displayed. Overall it was hard for chat to give
me a solid solution at the start due to it not knowing fully how
my project worked. Took many prompts and little tweaks in the code
until i got it to work. Chat help me in MainWindow.handleUserInput().
Used chatGPT to help me create helper functions for my parseGui and storage load()
method to make it from a super long function to a much shorter one.
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/pickle.chat.Pickle.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run pickle.chat.Pickle.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

Pickle is a simple, friendly chatbot that helps you keep track of your tasks.
1. Ensure you have **Java 11 or above** installed on your computer.
2. Download the latest `pickle.jar` release from this repository.
3. Open a terminal / command prompt in the folder containing the JAR.
5. You should see the welcome message:
Adds a simple task without any date/time attached.
Adds a task that must be completed by a specific date.
Adds a task that happens at a specific time or date.
Adds a task that requires a specific duration to be done.
Displays the full list of tasks currently stored.
Marks a task as not done (undoes a mark).
Removes a task from the list.
Shows tasks that contain the given keyword.
Pickle data are saved in the hard disk
the data. There is no need to save manually.
If you type something invalid, Pickle will warn you.

| **Error Handling** | Invalid commands will trigger an error message.
e.g., `foo bar` → `Yikes!!! foo bar Try Again!!` |
* Allows users to add, remove, mark and unmark tasks to do in a list
* Such tasks include, todos, deadlines and events.
